Reviews.Title: Just got it, no Google Play, but Netflix can be installed. UPDATE Included!
Reviews.Author: Lara
Reviews.Content: Just got it today, so I am giving it a 4 star (sadly last update Jan 2013, I had to reduce 2 stars from my review) and will update this review as I use it.  Here goes...I was eye balling the new Ipad (yeah, I am all things Mac), but honestly could not justify the $500+ (already have a macbook air that I can slip in my bag) for simply needing a tablet that can stream Netflix and perhaps some kids apps. My daughter loves watching Curious George, hence I needed a reasonable tablet that can keep her busy while visiting my workshop.I got this after reading the reviews for Coby Kyros MID7015  Coby Kyros MID7015 7-Inch Android  Internet Touchscreen Tablet - Black - so I knew many had said no Netflix (because there is no Google Play for this little guy), but I took a gamble (after reading that some people found a way around the no Google Play issue) and ordered the new version (MID7036-4) anyhow.Connecting to wireless was a breeze, the MID7036-4 comes with an app called GetJar, which will allow you to download many of the apps I was looking for, such as Netflix. However I went ahead and downloaded 1mobile (dot) com and downloaded Netflix, Angry Birds with ease. I used GetJar to download some puzzles and kids educational apps for my daughter.Netflix has been working without any issues and so did the Angry Birds (ahem, for me!). I have to admit, I was sure it was heading right back, but there is a way around no Google Play.Wanted to do a quick review for people in my shoes, looking for a compact tablet that was reasonable and was for Netflix etc...Please note that this is not an Ipad (or similar high end tablet) equivalent as far as resolution goes, but it is perfect for my needs. resolution is good enough, the touch screen is very reactive and functions great, the size is just right and has fit my Kindle Touch cover with ease.I will post more as I use it. Hope this helps :)Small Update / Nov 2nd, 20121. The battery life is about 2-3 hours while using Netflix.2. Connects to 2.4G but not to 5G band on my router.3. Connects to my Macbook Air and allows me to drag and drop music, photos with ease.Update / Nov 20th, 20121. Connects to my Windows (Sony laptop + other desktop) and I can drag movies and photos with ease.2. Can download Kindle reader from 1mobile(dot)com and read my kindle books (attaching images on the product for you all).3. GetJar app that this comes w does not have a lot of the apps I can get from Amazon or 1mobile4. Can add the tablet to my Amazon account and use the Kindle Fire apps.5. Can set parental control w/ the Android Parental Control app.Update / Nov 24th 20121. Installed Amazon Appstore, nice addition to my Imobile app store.2. Email set up: Was a breeze, I clicked email icon and entered my gmail address and followed the screen instructions. Email synced and works great.3. Downloaded Youtube app from Imobile (looked for it under the Amazon Appstore, but could not find it). Installed Youtube and it works great.4. Can open PDF files w/ Adobe Reader that is already installed in this tablet. There is also Office Suite in this tablet.Next up, testing the battery life for Kindle books :)Update / January 4, 2013 (Down 2 stars!)1. Kindle book battery life time is about 3 hours.2. The power jack (dc input) socket on the tablet is fragile, awkward and flimsy at best. It needs a light hand to plug the power adaptor (in order to charge). If you allow your youngster they may break this when pushing the power adaptor in. Knowing what I know about this tablet's flimsy power jack socket, I'd not be able to suggest this tablet whole heartedly (unless you have buyers protection w/ your credit card, like I did, and can get an easy refund incase yours breaks under 90 days).COBY, how could you skimp on the power jack socket?  Not cool at all! :/

Reviews.Title: Seems like a good budget tablet value
Reviews.Author: Bron "Bron"
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviewer, I had been considering the earlier model of this device, but due to the small price difference, it made sense to go or the latest model with the capacitive screen.  The unit comes nicely packaged with a printed manual, a slip case, a micro fiber cleaning cloth (small), a USB cable, AC charger, the tablet, and and some other cards, offers, and info.  All in all, a good quality box and package making for a nice first impression.I charged the battery and then turned on the tablet.  It booted up quickly and I set up my wifi connection with no problems at all.  Pretty much like any Android tablet.  There are a few basic apps installed (music, video, email, gallery (pics/vid, YouTube, etc.) and the GetJar app market.  You can read all about this under the 7015 (Coby Kyros MID7015 7-Inch Android  Internet Touchscreen Tablet - Black)reviews, so I won't repeat it here.  As others mention, you can use the 1mobile, Amazon or other app stores, and you can also download app packages to your PC and transfer them to the 7036 and run them to install.  (I will update once I've had more time to install and test additional apps.)If you used any of the larger automobile GPS units, this device will look very familiar.  The screen quality is similar, but fine for this price point.  Viewing angles are acceptable, contrast and black levels are not as good as pricier models, but are acceptable for this price.  One plus is that this unit has a USB port (for pc-tablet data transfers) and a micro SD card slot.  Many cheaper tablets do not. The screen flips to the proper orientation quickly as needed and as expected.  I like having the physical (back) button on the right side (in normal landscape mode).  You also have the usual touch screen functions, of course, but this sits right under your thumb and is very convenient.The 7036-4 has 4 GB internal flash, 512 MB RAM and a decent 1 GHz processor.  The screen is not as good as those on higher priced tablets, but it is acceptable.  800x600 would have been better, but 800x480 is good enough for video/photos. Text suffers though. The touch screen works fine and is very responsive.  The case is plastic and the unit is fairly light weight, but the quality seems fine for the asking price.There is no camera in this model (the 7048 includes one for only a few dollars more), however, the thing I really miss is bluetooth.  Bluetooth allows the easy connection of external speakers and wireless headphones.  You can buy Bluetooth adapters that can plug into the headphone jack, but this is not nearly as convenient, especially since the headphone jack is, unfortunately, located on the bottom, right corner of the unit.  Not sure what they were thinking, but it is not a very convenient location, in my opinion.  (Well, it's OK if you use this primarily holding it in your hands, but if you put it on a stand as I often do, it's a minor problem.)The Android 4 ICS OS installed is pretty much vanilla which is fine with me.  I felt right at home (I have several other Android devices.)  I have both smaller and larger units, this medium size unit is a good size for portable video viewing.  The sound is OK, it's mono (only one speaker), but quality is good enough, though most people will probably use headphones.  No GPS, but wifi location works as expected.Summary:*** So far, this device is meeting my goal of a smaller, more portable Android tablet.  My Thrive is way better, but it's also bigger and heavier.  So for "grab and go" trips around town, this is a better choice.  Plus if I drop or loose it, less pain than if it were my much more expensive Thrive (which I love, a super tablet). ***-- 800x480 Screen quality is OK for the price (not great, but acceptable).  Videos look pretty good, but text pixels are readily visible (see update below*).  Viewing angles acceptable.  Black levels adequate. Average quality, but good enough for this price.-- Performance is snappy overall.-- Build quality seems OK for the price point.-- Android OS is great.  No proprietary "tweaks" that I noticed.-- Nicely packaged with slip case, cleaning cloth, USB Cable, charger, etc.-- Has a USB port and a micro SD card slot (often missing in cheaper tablets)-- Painless setup right out of box.  Booted up and worked fine.-- No camera, no GPS, no Bluetooth (alas!)-- Videos played fine and looked good.  YouTube HD vids work fine.  SD Netflix played fine.-- Mono speaker, but good enough in a pinch.  Headphone jack available, of course, and stereo sound quality was fine when I plugged in my external stereo speaker.-- Lightweight, portable, feels solid enough.-- Excellent value for what you get - good bang for the buck.(*Text: I went into settings and changed the text size from "normal" to "large" which greatly improved the quality.  Not that much bigger, really, but better size for this resolution and looks much "smoother" to me.)Update:  I was able to install 1Mobile market (Update: I replaced this with Amazon App store which works better, for me anyway) and then apps like Pandora, Google Maps, App2SD, and so forth.Based on my usage so far, it appears battery life will be between 4-6 hours.  Best guess is 5 1/2.  Will update once I can confirm.  (Confirmed that I am getting roughly 5 hours of battery life, more or less, depending on use. Can get 6-7 hours or more with light use, turn screen/wifi off while playing music, but 5-6 hours seems reasonable.  Will be less if streaming video full time, of course.  Lara in her review indicates 2-3 hours.)Update:  Was able to install Amazon App store and installed Netflix which works fine.  Amazon app store seems a bit better and more reliable than 1mobile.  Both work.  To use Amazon you must have an Amazon account and register your device (email).  You get an email with the apk which you can then install easily.  The email has step by step instructions.  Works much better for me than 1mobile.I've had a few minor issues with the touch screen, but mostly me getting used to it.  Have to go a bit slower and more carefully than on my Thrive.  Size difference of course.  Have installed a bunch more apps from Amazon store and they have all worked fine, no problems at all.Update 11-19-2012: This has actually dropped in price recently.  Mine is still working great and I am very happy with it.  An even better value now.Update 2013 Mar 07 -- still working fine and no complaints.  This is my "backup" tablet -- but I often grab it first for trips where I don't want to risk my "good" more expensive tablet and it always gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: It is inexpensive...
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: Well, for what it costs, it's just barely tolerable.  I bought it to test developing with Android.  For that purpose, as a lowest common denominator device, it works fairly admirably.  On the other hand, this is nearly the bare bones minimum you need to do Netflix / surf the web / play games etc.  This thing is just barely fast enough to play Netflix SD.  For light web, book reading and email, it would serve pretty well given the price.  I plan on buying one for my Mom, and maybe as a treat for one of my kids if they do well in school.  But it's certainly no Nexus 7 or iPad.  But hey, it is cheap as all get out, and it works, so that's pretty hard to argue with.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet for the money
Reviews.Author: Rebecca L. Murray
Reviews.Content: Nice tablet for the money. There is an error in the product description. It says the Coby Kryos has a USB2 port. It does not; it has a micro USB port and comes with a male/male micro to USB2 cable. If you plan to use it with a keyboard case, I would recommend you buy  a male micro USB to female USB2 adapter when you buy the tablet. There are two ways to get that adapter: by purchasing a whole adapter kit from BestBuy for about $15 and end up with a bunch of adapters you may not need, or order it on-line. They typically only run you about $3 if you go the on-line ordering route.Pros:* Intuitive to use. If you've ever used a modern smart phone, even one that is not an Android, you will have no learning curve.* Decent built-in speaker. I have a Kindle Fire and the speaker on this little $90 tablet is noticeably better.* nice, responsive touch screen; not too picky but didn't require multiple touches to get it to respond to a finger swipe, either.* Ran most of my Kindle Fire apps just fine so I didn't have to re-buy many.* Nice selection of free apps available on the native app center.* Accepted the 32 gig micro SD card I scavenged out of my old Palm Centro just fine.* Docked right up to my main computer just fine and transferred file just fine. Downloaded Office Pro quickly and opened the Office docs I transferred to it just fine.* Light weight so using the on-screen keybord was actually pretty comfortable, unlike the heavier 7" tablets I've used.* Pretty good speed at web surfing and handled You Tube, Hotmail, and Face Book just fine.Cons:* I really wish it had a USB2 adapter.* Didn't really match the pictures displayed exactly.* It's not as fast as my Kindle Fire, so if you are looking for high-end performance, you might be disappointed.* Picture quality leaves a bit to be desired but is ok for most uses. If you primarily want to watch movies on it, you might be disappointed.Conclusion:I didn't want yet another gadget but I needed access to Office while my big computer renders 3D animated scenes. Quite frankly, if the Kindle Fire could be docked with an external keyboard, I would not have bought this one. That being said, it's a pretty decent little machine for the money. It's not an iPad, but then again, it didn't cost nearly as much as an iPad, either. If you want a basic tablet PC that won't break the bank, this one is a good choice. I only gave it 4 stars because of the fouled up description.

Reviews.Title: quit whining
Reviews.Author: Ashlie
Reviews.Content: I got this for my 3 year old so he stops stealing my phone to play angry birds and to watch youtube videos of mario. This is really nice, and now I want one for myself. People need to quit whining about the play store or cough up the money for the samsung tab. This is a nice tablet, touch works great, and my son will love it.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected!
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet after seeing it in a local market where I live, but not being quick enough to get one before the stock ran out. Finding it on Amazon for only $3 more, I quickly snatched it up!First of all, I knew that with buying a cheap tablet that I was going to get a "cheap" tablet, but I do have to say that this tablet turned out way better than I expected. Of course, it doesn't come with the Google Play Store by default, but if you're tech savvy enough you can work your way around this (like I did). The resolution is a little watered down, but it still looks good for a 7" screen. The touch part is quite responsive and I've yet to have any real issues with the touch screen. It's a snappy, good-looking tablet for $83. The sound is a little lacking as well, having only a single speaker on the device. But for me, this is not a problem as I rarely ever use my tablet without headphones.My only real complaint I have with this tablet is the battery life. I use my devices pretty regularly, and heavily, so my experience might be different from yours. But the life I've gotten out of it so far is around 4 hours, and that's with heavy gaming, web surfing and the screen brightness set to max.All in all, if you're looking for a tablet to play with and try out but don't want to fork out some serious cash, I'd say definitely get this one. I'm actually thinking about buying a second one for my wife so she'll leave mine alone, haha!Coby Kyros MID7036-4

Reviews.Title: Charging port defect (and it looks like it is not just mine)
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my teenager and she was so excited but then became frustrated because she could not get any apps. We found a app store for her and she fell in love again and has played it daily since Christmas taking optimal care of it. She was in tears last night when she went to charge it and the charging port thing pushed inside the tablet and now is a useless piece of junk. I went on coby's website to find out what to do and found out that in order for them to replace/fix this I have to send them a $6 money order for return shipping, I think Coby should be responsible for all cost associated with this because this seems to be a big issue with this product. Type in charger in the reviews for this product and you will see the real problem with this product.I would highly recommend not buying this product (may be worth $10). If you do hold your breath every time you go to charge it because it will soon snap off inside and be useless.

Reviews.Title: Poorly made
Reviews.Author: Shane Jennings
Reviews.Content: Charge port broke off the main board after a week of use. Cheaply made with cheap materials. Next time I will be buying something better made. Even something made from plastic should not have the internals break after a week of normal use.

Reviews.Title: Nice Cost-to-Quality Ratio for the Price
Reviews.Author: B. Ellis
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: I'm a Kindle Fire (1st Gen) owner who lost track of one of his compact-sized MP3 players.  In wanting to purchase a new MP3 player with the potential for upgraded storage (via MicroSD) I stumbled across this little jewel on Amazon.  It now serves as an MP3 player (32GB MicroSD holds plenty of music) and general-use tablet for the house.  By adding the Amazon App Market (Amazon has instructions for this on their site), I've been able to download my Kindle titles as well, for when my girlfriend would like to read them or when the Fire's charge is low and I don't want to be tethered to a short cord.  For the price, I'd say this was well-worth the purchase.  A few caveats:◘ The screen is nowhere near the quality of the first-gen Kindle Fire, much less its newer iterations.  Viewing at a slight angle seems reminiscent of first-generation plasma/projection TV's, where one has to be directly in front of the screen and center-level to see absolutely everything.  The resolution is much lower than any current $200-range tablet offering, but let's be honest...you won't buy this for watching HD movies/television programming, and even so, you still can use it for this purpose...just don't expect to be blown away by the low-quality images.  On the bright side (pun not originally intended), you can adjust the brightness output to make the screen more visible.  The "touch" functionality is not top-notch...it is a bit rough-around-the-edges, if I'm honest...but for what you can do with this tablet, it's a small sacrifice.◘ Sound quality from the built-in speaker is "OK" at best, but much better if you plug in some external speakers.◘ Battery life is decent...if I only use this for playing music and the occasional web-browsing, a charge can last most of the day.  I imagine you can run this battery down in under three hours if you watch videos continuously.Bottom Line: For the price, this is a great little tablet.  Perhaps if you're looking to get a tablet for a young person and you don't want to drop $200-$400 on a "mainstream" tablet, this will not only provide the basic functionality, but will a little extra work (installing the Amazon App Market, for example) it can grow with that person as time progresses.  Otherwise it makes a great around-the-house reader/media player/web browser.

Reviews.Title: Three Replacements for the Same Issue!
Reviews.Author: Charity Alejos
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet for my son for Christmas.  I didn't want to spend a lot of money on a tablet for my 5-year-old, and I knew I didn't need it to have a lot of capabilities, so I thought this was a good product for both of us.  Within 3 weeks of receiving the product, the prong where the power cord plugs into the tablet broke, preventing us from being able to charge the tablet.  Amazon returns are such a snap, so we were pleased to simply return it, and we had a new one within a couple of days.  After three more weeks or so...the SAME thing happened!  I was mystified!  I had read this same issue that others had had, before I purchased it...but I had thought...maybe they just had a bit of bad luck.  Sadly...no.  So, for a second time, I returned the tablet, and a new one was quickly shipped by Amazon.  This one lasted almost two months...but today...SAME THING HAPPENED!!  Ugh!  So, I am finally returning this product for a refund.  I will gladly pay the extra $100 to get a product that lasts more than 30 days.  Oh...and did I mention that this tablet does not support Google Play.  1 Mobile (a free program you can download) does work.  And there are lots of free games that you can use.  But, disturbingly...today...my son tells me..."I was looking up games to download, and something gross came up.  It was something going into something."  I quickly grabbed the tablet from him...and sure enough...there is a picture of a male body part, entering a female body part!  I was mortified.  All in all...this is NOT a product for a child, not a product for a gamer, and not a product for someone that wishes to keep their tablet for more than a month without have to return it over and over.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing, you really get what u pay for!
Reviews.Author: Dgordon
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a x-mas gift for my 6yr old and figured I could use it too. It worked the first week. After that, when we tried to turn it on it just kept booting up and never got pass the Coby screen. I'm not going to bother replacing it with the same type. I'm asking for a refund so I can Pay the difference and get a more reliable model.  I was nervous about purchasing it in the first place but took a chance.

Reviews.Title: just bought
Reviews.Author: mtec4655
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my little sister for Christmas (yea haven't given it to her yet but I've been setting it up for her). The size is great for (and the price was great for me!) As my sister is only 5 there is not a lot she needs access to but has wanted a tablet for about a year after a friend let her play on theirs. I expect she will be delighted with this tablet and wont get bored within 5 minutes of playing with it (one can hope anyway) As I have been setting it up, its easy use and, like i said a good size. I don't currently own a ipad or Nexxus so I can not compare them but I am thoroughly happy with this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Just received. Seems ok.
Reviews.Author: chrisasst
Reviews.Content: I am not really sure why all of the 1 stars for this device.  I received this a few days ago.  I have read the reviews here and else where and made the simple addon's that were suggested. Like downloading 1mobile.com  You can download the youtube app that works, the facebook app that works.  I have not downloaded the netflix app because I don't know if I need that.  It also linked to my wireless Dlink router with in a matter of seconds of turning the wireless option on.  You should be able to delete some of the preinstalled app to free up more memory.  So far it runs fine.Forgot to mention that one thing that makes it a 4 star is the low speaker volume.

Reviews.Title: I wanted to like this tablet, I really did...can I talk myself into it?
Reviews.Author: Laura Sanchez
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet with the intention of gifting it to my 7 year old son.  Just wanted a basic tablet for him to play free Android apps and enjoy having a device of his own instead of using our smartphones. I assumed any economy Android tablet could perform the task, just wouldn't have the processor speed, RAM and storage of a more expensive tablet.  I was WRONG.I assumed I would be able to choose between using Coby's GetJar or downloading apps for Google Play store and Amazon Appstore.  Just as my Android phone came with GooglePlay and I was able to add the Amazon appstore.  I was wrong.  No access to GooglePlay, and while Amazon appstore worked the first time, now it only has a search bar that won't function and a blank screen. I know I can try re-installing and fiddle with it more, but I can't help feeling I shouldn't have to. Calling this an Android device should mean I can use its browser to go to any website (Google Play, Amazon, etc.) and download the app for their Android compatible app store.Add to that the resistive touch screen. I understand its a different technology and has the same learning curve of getting used to its functionality as the capacitive touchscreen on most other touch devices.  But that's just it, every other device I own is capacitive, and that's what we're used to.  On this screen you have to push HARD, and your finger does not slide as smoothly across the surface as it does on a capacitive screen. When web browsing for app stores this device doesn't work with, if I drag my finger to scroll and don't push hard enough, it clicks links instead of scrolling, making web-browsing a hassle.  Plus the corners have almost very low sensitivity.  Want to push that tiny "X" in the corner to close the ad in free app games? Good luck!Should I have ordered the capacitive version of this tablet? On one hand I wish I had, on the other, I have to admit that would only solve half the problem, better touch function, but still sub-par Android access.Overall I really wanted to like this tablet, I didn't expect much to begin with, just the basic function of a 7 year old playing Angry Birds, DrawSomething,etc.  I didn't think that would be pushing the abilities of this device, but GetJar doesn't have DrawSomething or half of the other apps my son likes to play on my phone, so apparently I do want more than this device can provide. Sure I can google how to hack it, and I have, but I hesitate to tamper with the system files because again I shouldn't have to do that just to get Android access on an Android device!To be fair, I should add that I ordered myself a Kindle Fire(Standard Def 8gb, not HD) the same day as this Coby Kyros. I knew it would be superior, just not to this extreme. Even if I do keep fiddling and decide to gift this, I think there are good odds my son would be happier sharing a Kindle Fire with me than having this tablet to himself.  Would he be happy using this despite the issues or just frustrated and dissapointed? Not trying to write a scathing review (although I see its starting to sound like one), just wanted to give an honest view of what to expect if you buy this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Cheap
Reviews.Author: Epiphany
Reviews.Content: The price was good, but the case is made of plastic and is cheap feeling. It creaks in your hands when you hold it tightly.

Reviews.Title: product
Reviews.Author: Deette mcwilliams
Reviews.Content: I would not buy this product again. the kindle is definitely a way better product for the price I have 3 kindles and customer service is excellent. I have returned the android and have had no response back for months .

Reviews.Title: Poor customer service from the Coby
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet in December 2012 as a gift for my daughter. Two months after receiving it, the part where you plug it in to charge just caved in. I called Coby and they said I could send it to get repaired for free, just send a $15 money order so they could ship it back. I followed their instructions, and sent the tablet in March. It's now October, and I still haven't gotten my tablet back. I've called several times but every time I call I get a different story. It's always some lame excuse, followed by "Your tablet will get back to you within a few weeks". 5 times now that "few weeks" has passed without my tablet coming back. If you are thinking about buying this, just take a look at Coby Electronics facebook page. [...] It's so bad they had to make it so people couldn't comment on their page. But read the comments posted on ANY of their posts. My problem with the company is not just a fluke....Don't buy this. You are better off spending a little more on something from a more reputable company. I lost out on the $100 I payed for it, the $15 I spent shipping it back to them, and the $15 I sent with it so they could ship it back.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Slow Granny
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my grandson in January and the adapter fell out in June.  We went through warranty process to have replaced in 6 weeks and have not received a replacement yet.  The phones refer you to the web tech support but all emails are returned.  Corporate office number doesn't answer.  If you buy, you will be on your own.  Just as well throw the money away.

Reviews.Title: Return Product
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to contact the 877-302-2629 number for customer service and all it does it tell me to email consumercare@cobyusa.com or techsupport@cobyusa.com and no one has replied to emails for over a month. I spend alot of money with Amazon I do not feel that these people should be allowed to treat Amazon customers this way. So, if any one from Amazon is reading this I hope I can get a resolution to the poor quality service that I am receiving. I even went so far to purchase an extended warranty on this product and can not get any satisfaction for this product not working.Sincerely,Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY FROM THIS MANUFACTURER!!!
Reviews.Author: Tina1219
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product from Toys R Us during the 2012 Black Friday event for $69.99.  When we first received the product it worked well but within two month's time, the charging plug/hole was pushed in somehow and we have been unable to use it since.  For some time now, we have been attempting to contact the manufacturer, Coby USA, for support under the one year warranty.  Unfortunately, it is as though the company does not exist.  On the website, which looks legit, they advise you to call 1- 877-302-2629 for issues related to replacement and/or warranty information, and 1-800-688-2629 for general contact questions.  Both of these phone numbers do not allow you to speak with a representative...  I have also emailed the company at the listed support email on the website (consumercare@cobyusa.com) and this comes back as invalid!  After months of attempting to get some answers, I realized that I am obviously not the only person having this same issue.  At this website ([...] other consumers listed their failed attempts to contact the company and also describe sending their product and return shipping fee for replacements and never seeing their product again.  WHAT A SCAM!!!  I have now been forced to contact Toys R Us and hope that they can help.Please be VERY careful when purchasing unless you don't mind spending money and don't care if your have a technical issue or need a replacement within the provided one year warranty time-frame....

Reviews.Title: Cheap! Horrible customer service!
Reviews.Author: Doug woolley
Reviews.Content: Yea It is inexpensive but it is simply very poor quality.  I bought 5 of these for my kids and all of them have hardware issues.  The power plugin has come detached from the board on two of them.  I sent one in to Coby for repair under warranty.  They repaired it but it took 2 months.  All they did was replace it with a refurbish.  Why two months?!  They require a 15 dollar money order for return postage and I pay postage to send it in.  Not bad if the cost of shipping wasn't almost half the cost of the unit.  The second one that had a power source problem has been a nightmare.  Getting someone on the phone is the problem.  Coby is unresponsive.  I have called probably 100 times and emailed them but to no avail--i have yet had a person on the phone or even a return email.  Horrible customer service.  You can put a piece of shit in a box and slap a year warranty on it put that doesn't mean it's a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy anything made by Coby
Reviews.Author: Kristine Schwartzman
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband in 2012. It was perfect for his limited needs and he loved it. In May, the screen faded out and could not be read. I emailed CobyUSA and was told it was defective. The tablet was still under warranty. I was given an address to return it and told to include the receipt, a detailed list of what was wrong and a $15 money order for return shipping. I did all of that. It is now nearly two months later and I do not have a new tablet. Customer service is non-existent. All I get out of the customer "support" people is that the new tablet is still in the warehouse with no shipping information. I called corporate headquarters and unless you know the person's name, you cannot get anyone. The "operator" did not answer, a recording told me to leave a message, then a recording said there was no space left to record a message. I found a site that listed contacts, directors, CEOs, etc., so I went back to the corporate headquarters phone directory and have now left messages with two people there. We will see if anyone calls me back. I will amend this review if they do something but I doubt I will hear from anyone. Totally disgusted.July 24, 2013 Update:  Called their "support" center again and got a different excuse this time. It is 2 months now since they received my defective tablet. Today I am told that the warehouse is closed for inventory and I should call back August 1, 2013 for the status. Are you kidding? Do not buy anything from Coby Electronics.August 9, 2013 Update: I have not received the replacement tablet and Coby is no longer answering their support phone number. There is a recording that says go to the web site. There is no way to talk to a person.

Reviews.Title: Warranty Service is terrible
Reviews.Author: Tonto7
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: June 24, 2013COBY still has not replaced my tablet, although their warranty service department did finally acknowledge that they did receive it (six weeks after the PO delivery slip said they got it). They've had possession of the defective unit for 11 1/2 weeks. Guess what? I bought a competitor's product as a replacement - don't know what I'll do with whatever COBY sends me - if they ever send me anything. The original unit supposedly came with a 1 year warranty - I asked if I would be prorated for the amount of time it's in their facility. That was a joke - "OF COURSE NOT"! They said they'd probably send a newer version, perhaps a 9" tablet as a replacement. Problem is, I don't want a larger tablet. And, a replacement would most likely be a 'refurbished' unit. Guess what? Those only have a 90 day warranty. So, I'll get something I don't want (maybe) and lose 5 months of warranty in the process. THANKS COBY!!!!!!!!!!Original post May 6, 2013I opted for this item through a credit card rewards program in December 2012 as a tool to use while traveling to access internet and email. It worked fine for about 4 months, and then it would no longer achieve an internet connection. Initially, COBY's technical support response was fine, but they could not resolve the issue, and told me to return it under warranty. That's where their service ended.  The unit has been in their warranty repair center for a month, and they still don't have it logged into their system as having been received for repair. I spent 3 days calling their customer service at 800-727-3592 and never got through. First I got a recording telling me that all service representatives were busy and was disconnected. Later, I got the same message and was put on hold. 30 minutes later, I gave up.  Today when I called, all I got was a busy signal. I finally did manage to locate another # 877-302-2629 and spoke to a representative who told me that there was no record in their system yet, so I should call back next week, and it might show up then.  At this point in time, I'm ready to forget about the COBY and just buy a replacement from another manufacturer who is more reliable.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: Lisa G. Ledyard
Reviews.Content: I bought both my boys a Coby tablet and both broke where you plug charger into tablet, this is not covered by square trade warranty if you have it, you have to send back to Coby and they make you send them a $15 money order!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: juliette josey
Reviews.Content: After having my tablet just four weeks the screen went blank.  i can hear things happening but unable to turn off.  i tried resetting it but to no avail.  I am very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Product
Reviews.Author: Christen
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed with this tablet.  We bought it for our son for Christmas and the charging socket came loose in the unit not three weeks later.  There is no other way to charge it which is downfall number one.  We called Coby and surprise, surprise this is so common that turn around time for repairs are 8 weeks.  I sent it off with a check because they require you to pay shipping both ways for their inferior products.  We waited and waited with an 8yr old who was so anxious to get his tablet back.  I finally called this poor excuse of a company and they told me that because I sent a check and not a money order they are just holding my tablet!!!  What?!!!  When were you going to let me know this?  How long were they just going to sit on our tablet without doing anything?  Their only answer was that normally they send a letter but "I guess something got messed up." I am so mad.  DO NOT buy Coby Products - they are inferior and their customer service STINKS!!  All for a lousy $15 bucks.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!  Easy to use, works well.
Reviews.Author: Barry "Barry"
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for a person that is "technologically challenged".  He loves it, it is easy to use and is on it all the time.  Great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Decent For My Needs.
Reviews.Author: Mike Del Modesto "Tooler"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 8 year old after buying his older brother a 4'th gen, 32 gig iPod Touch because he'd been grabbing his brother's iPod on the down low and messing with his apps...lol I didn't want to get him a 'great' tablet like Galaxy Tab or Kindle Fire HD for two reasons, the first is that between he and my 5 year old they'd scratch, ding, dent and eventually break it, the other reason is that I might have taken it as my own, so the Coby Kyros it was. I didn't expect the overall quality to be outstanding but it turned out that the stock operating system is not "sanctioned(?)" by Android and so one can't use Play Store apps. I downloaded a "patch (again...?)" and the "official" Gingerbread OS which has worked really well. I did this a while back but I'll be posting the links & steps later. The screen is just OK, the sound is just OK, the battery life is `meh and the entire thing feels flimsy BUT!... I only paid like $90 for an Android wi-fi tablet for an 8 year old child so I'm content even with all the "flaws" I pointed out.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for....barely!
Reviews.Author: ERIKA VIDAL
Reviews.Content: It functions fine at first, has the entertaining things about a tablet (minus a camera)....but it stopped charging after about 1.5-2 months. So I have to find a replacement charger, and if that doesnt work, its done.  I wont waste my money on something like this again.  I would rather pay a little more and get something that lasts longer.

Reviews.Title: tablet only worked for a month
Reviews.Author: beclaugh
Reviews.Content: My child was so excited to purchase a tablet for him & his older brother with his own money. After doing such a sweet gesture his tablet starts to mess up within a month and completely died within a week. Very disappointed with product!

Reviews.Title: no play store
Reviews.Author: havokhaven
Reviews.Content: as mentioned by others this tablet does not come with play store or other official google apps. but there is a way to get them on it. go to this site [...] and follow the directions. i got play store working like a charm. makes it more bearable but customer service is so poor when i was trying to exchange the tablet instead of trying to find a way around the issue.

Reviews.Title: Bad product, had to return 2
Reviews.Author: Marc
Reviews.Content: Purchased this product for my 2 girls for Christmas and have had to return both.  One had issues with the battery it could not take a charge.  The second one would just crash randomly.

Reviews.Title: product defects Coby Kyros MID7036
Reviews.Author: alexi
Reviews.Content: Coby Kyros 7-Inch Android 4.0 4 GB Internet Tablet 16:9 Capacitive Multi-Touch Widescreen, Black MID7036-4Device cannot properly play MP4 videos, screen freezes at certain points although the audio continuously plays.To check if there is a firmware update, there is no such feature in the settings.

Reviews.Title: Broken power input with no USB charging option
Reviews.Author: Eldon Thompson
Reviews.Content: The AC power input on this item contains a very weak pin that snapped off without any undue force being applied. The unit cannot receive power via USB connection, as the micro USB port is for data transfer only. In the end, we paid $100 for a tablet that lasted all of 34 days.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: G. Brown
Reviews.Content: I essentially found what other reviewers have found. This is a solid device that gives you just about everything that more expensive unites give except it's slower, has less storage, and is limited in the "apps" it can access. I have enjoyed playing with it and learning its capabilities and limitations. If I were to pick the most glaring limiting factor it would be the restrictive access to certain apps. I'm still experimenting with this issue but even it is not that much of a show stopper. If you have some patience and want to get into Tablets at a low cost level (before going whole-hog), this is not a bad starter. By the way, I have experienced no hardware problems with the device. Everything works as stated!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Graig Wheelock
Reviews.Content: The overall performance of the device is fine.  The battery life is disappointing 3 to 4 hours at best.  I purchased this device for my wife and she is not hard on it, but after only a month the dc jack in the tablet is loose and doesn't charge the device properly.  Very poor design as far as the dc jack goes.

Reviews.Title: Liked it, but power jack is a problem
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: Just want to reiterate what other reviews are saying.  It is a decent tablet for the price after making some minor tweaks, but the power jack will break off.The power jack is not attached very well and will easily break off from regular use.  Stay away from this tablet if possible.  There are other comparable tablets around the same price that do not have this problem.Once I get mine replaced, I will get the power jack attached better.  If your power jack isn't broken off yet, I would advice to reinforce the connections by getting it soldered or soldering it yourself.

Reviews.Title: Difficult to charge, Amazon Appstore crashes
Reviews.Author: Disappointed Father
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my 5 year old because I couldn't stomach the price of an Ipad or elite tablet for someone so young.  Turns out I should have at least sprung for a midrange tablet rather than wasting my time on this.  It's basic funtionality was ok for a 5 year old, she enjoyed the games and apps we coudl download.  The biggest problem was with chargine the device.  It could not be charge via USB, but only using the AC adapter included.  The adapter plug didn't fit correctly into the device, which made it difficult to charge.  The plug had to be pushed in very hard, harder than a 5 year old could push, and then left absolutely still and flat while charging or it wouldn't charge.  A second issue was the appstore.  Koby has it's own appstore, but the apps are limited.  I tried using Amazon's appstore, which I was able to do, but it crashed after every download and had to be reinstalled, making the process quite painful.  Amazon customer service was great as always in helping me get a device that would work for my daughter, but I wish I wouldn't have wasted the time with the Kyros and I'm sure my daughter wishes she didn't have to exchange her Christmas gift.

Reviews.Title: Great product but.....
Reviews.Author: Sherene
Reviews.Content: great service for delivery, got it on time but..... unfortunatelyyyy its not charging , had to get it repaired and very disappointed because i would think tht they should check it before shipping it.. seriously i m afraid to buy stuff online now because u dont know what youre getting until u get it, and if youre lucky it will work perfectly fine, unlike me ....

Reviews.Title: Cheap...I regret my purchase...
Reviews.Author: Kelli Godfrey
Reviews.Content: I'm glad that I only bought one of these tablets and it was for my 11 year old. This thing is made very cheaply and does very little. I assured my daughter that if she could take care of this one then she could upgrade later. I wish we would have went ahead and paid an extra hundred bucks for her to get a nexus like mine. This Coby Kyros Tablet does not have the Google Play store. I have tried rooting it like a few people said online was possible but it just won't work. Also I have tried to get her some apps and games from Amazon, every time I close amazon, I have to un install it and install it again just to make it come back on to use it! Even when I do, I can't download most important f the games I can on my nexus. It won't even give me the options on the Coby to buy the games that are free on my appstore which really make no sense. PLEASE JUST SPEND THE EXTRA LITTLE BIT AND GET SOMETHING DIFFERENT! YOU WILL REGRET BUYING THIS.

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: Edidem Nkpoikana Etubom Ekpeyong Henshaw III
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time with this product. Nothing seems to download. I bought because the reviews were good. But it sems those reviews were not accurate.

Reviews.Title: It was better than I tought!
Reviews.Author: maggie
Reviews.Content: It was far beyond better than my expectations. I will recomend this Tablet to everybody. I can do more things than I tought I could do it. Now I do not need my computer. Everything is inside my Tablet. The best of all? It is so easy to carry with me anywhere I go. The quality is excelent. Fast shipping. And a great price!!!I love Amazon. You are my favorite store in the world. You are very responsible and the qualities of your products is excellent. The prices are the best too.I bought almost all my stuff in the comfortability of my house. Did not spend any money in gas or time going to the stores in FL. You made my life easier this end of the year. Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Love them!
Reviews.Author: Baron
Reviews.Content: We purchased three of these for our three boys for Christmas. They love them! We didn't want to spend a lot on something that could possibly be dropped or broken since our boys are not the most careful children in the world. :-) We downloaded 1mobile and that gave them access to all of the games they wanted.

Reviews.Title: Great for a month! Terrible after that.
Reviews.Author: Julie "Green Chick"
Reviews.Content: I haven't gotten to use it too much yet, but I love it! It was a family present from me to myself, my kids, and my husband. The kids are happy because they can play Angry Birds, and I am happy because I can browse the internet and watch Netflix. So far I have no complaints. It's simple to use, fast, and holds a good charge.EDIT January 12, 2014:This thing didn't last even two months before the little jack where you plug the charger into pushed all the way into the tablet and disappeared. I was unable to charge it anymore, so obviously it stopped working. I contacted Amazon, who suggested I contact Coby directly. I never could get anyone to answer, so I am just out $100. This was my family's big Christmas gift last year, and it's absolute junk. I rescind my previous recommendations of it.

Reviews.Title: Bought It for Dad
Reviews.Author: Caryn Colgan "Caryn"
Reviews.Content: I bought a 10" for Mom and Dad kept using it to play solitaire so I bought this for him. At first I was worried it would be too small for his large fingers. He loves it. He plays on it for hours every day. The screen is bright enough and it's easy to navigate, even for a technophobe. We found enough solitaire apps to give him hours of enjoyment. On the downside, the games appear pixelated. This device is not for advanced users due to limited apps and screen resolution.

Reviews.Title: Broke in less than two weeks, barely used
Reviews.Author: Frequent online shopper
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this tablet as a Christmas gift for my father, who isn't the most tech savvy person but does like playing computer games like chess and cards.  I had opened it and was in the process of loading it up with games and a few useful apps so that it would be ready for him to play with on Christmas morning.  Last night I had plugged in the charger and expected it to be charged by morning, but it had only charged about 8%.  I thought this was odd, but shrugged it off.  I readjusted both ends of the charger, at the wall socket end and into the tablet.  Several hours later when I came back to check, it still hadn't charged.  Uh oh.  I removed the end plugged into the tablet and replaced it, pushing it in until the large 'battery' charging icon flashed briefly.. and then the cord fell out.  Apparently the internal part of the DC charger (the little silver stem that goes into the cord) had dislodged itself and fallen back into the case.  I can now hear it rattling around in there.  Since the micro-usb cord can only be used for transferring files and will not charge that way, the tablet is now completely non-operational.  What makes this even worse is that while Amazon will replace the defective item, but it won't arrive until after Christmas - nothing says great gift like an "IOU" because the original item got sent back.  :(  I very much hope this unit was a fluke and that the new one will hold up, although some of the other reviews about tablets not holding charges or turning on anymore is worrisome.  Based on how nice it looks and the reasonable price for a basic tablet (hence the reason for two stars instead of one), I will give Coby a second change and update this review after seeing how the second one performs.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: Aaron Parks "The Drifter"
Reviews.Content: We bought this tablet for our 10 yr old for Christmas. Of course I had to get it out and charge the battery and set it up for him, and I think its a great tablet. The build quality is good, the screen is nice and clear, the Capacitive touch screen is super responsive. It runs pretty smoothly, I'm rather impressed with how quick it is for being a single core processor with 512mb of RAM. We are very happy with this purchase. I dont think I could have done better for $85 Shipped.

Reviews.Title: Good enough for little kids, not much else.
Reviews.Author: Douglas J. Simmons "arinekhen"
Reviews.Content: It's a good value for giving to a child who will not need any google services and will only play some games. Not all will work, of course, but most of the popular ones will, and I'm pleased about that. Screen quality is poor, very dull and narrow range of viewable angles. Slow responses, both in running apps and in screen taps. Install 1mobile first thing, because putting google play on it requires root, invalidating the warranty, and only a few versions of Amazon App store will work - if you get one working, do not let it update, because newer ones will give you only a black screen. 1mobile is good enough for getting games and some educational apps. Getjar is useless. I think of this as a good training toy to prepare a child for more expensive equipment later.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Samantha Prescott
Reviews.Content: Got this for everyday use. Email, Facebook, Google, etc. It was exactly what I needed to have on the go.

Reviews.Title: Great little tablet
Reviews.Author: vincent himpe
Reviews.Content: Not the fastest in the world but perfect as a llittle tablet to run a few apps and check the mail. I run the connection software for the home automation software through this. ideal to control the lights and alarm system. I installed the Honeyweel software for the L5100 and paired this with the central system. works flawless. I actually modded the tablet so it became a wall-mounted unit.

Reviews.Title: 1mobile.com!!!! will save this tablet
Reviews.Author: Tamala Baker
Reviews.Content: For the price this thing is perfect... you cant use google play BUT 1mobile does the exact same thing ...i downloaded netflix, temple run, facebook apps and others ... the little thing is fast and perfect for my 6 yr old.  the only drawback is no camera

Reviews.Title: Awful
Reviews.Author: Michelle Kane
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these tablets for my daughters. Thankfully I opened them up to install apps before Christmas and realized what a piece of junk this tablet it. The GetJar app store worked for two days although the apps were not anything close to what can be found on itunes or the amazon app store. GetJar stopped working and the customer support number I called said to go to "Slideme.org" because Coby no longer supports GetJar. So I tried installing the Amazon app store mainly because I wanted to install the pbs kids apps. The download worked briefly enough for me to install one pbs app. When I tried again later the Amazon app store would not work and I had to uninstall it. I guess you get what you pay for. I'm returning this and will probably just end up getting apple products.

Reviews.Title: Dont let the bad reviews scare you off
Reviews.Author: FUzzyBUnny
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of searching for a tablet for my wife. She has a laptop also but just wanted something small that she could use while laying in bed. I was a little skeptical after reading some of the reviews on this product. I decided that if it didn't do what she wanted it to we could always return it. She has barely put it down since she has gotten it. I surprised her with it as a early valentines present a couple of weeks ago. The only problem that she has had was once it locked up and we had to push the reset button. Other then that she has played a bunch of games that she downloaded for it as well as Netflix movies that she watches on it pretty much daily.So if you are looking at tablets and you are concerned about the reviews on this one I would say not to worry too much. The bad thing about reviews is that most people that are happy with a item don't bother writing reviews. Usually it is only the people that had a problem that feel they need to lash out at a company because they had a problem. So my guess would be that there are thousands of people out there that are perfectly happy with it and only a few that had problems that decided to post a review of it.

Reviews.Title: I'd rather leave "0" stars
Reviews.Author: ElizabethC
Reviews.Content: This thing is awful! There is no Google Play Store (to get apps), nor any other way except through "GetJar". GetJar is horrible and gives you terrible crappy apps that aren't even at the right resolution or right size for a tablet. I was extremely irritated, as was my very techy husband. We are returning it and so did my Mother-in-Law who bought 2 of them for my nieces.

Reviews.Title: 2 out of 3 ordered arrived with issues
Reviews.Author: bodiddy825
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ordered 3 of these, 2 for our children and the third for a nephew.  Well after unboxing we began to install apps for the kids and found it extremely difficult to navigate through the getjar store without inadvertently clicking on something / somewhere that wasn't needed (almost impossible to scroll down).  After about an hour we finally had the same 3 apps on each device and they began to use them.  This is when we noticed the first one had a speaker issue.  No matter what we did, we couldn't get any sound out of the device and a lot of fun it is to play games without sound.  That one went back into the box.  After the other 2 finished playing we went to charge the remaining two devices only to find out that one of those wouldn't charge.  We tried both chargers available and it wouldn't see either charger.  This one is now back in it's original box.We're going to end up shipping all three back and get our 2 kids a galaxy tab, nexus 7 or kindle fire hd then give my sister the cash that we used so she can either get my nephew a different device or use the $ for something else.

Reviews.Title: So cheap it only lasted two weeks
Reviews.Author: electric woodsman
Reviews.Content: The tiny charging port has already broke. I received it around November 26th 2012 and On December 7th 2012 it has already stopped charging. If it is in a very specific spot it charge intermittently but takes all day to reach a full charge. I knew I was buying an inferior product but I did expect it to last at least 6 months to a year. I will try returning it if I can locate the inner packaging. Stay away from this product.

Reviews.Title: Damaged charger
Reviews.Author: PEDRO MORENO
Reviews.Content: After purchasing this product, I tried to communicate with the seller to indicate that the charger was failing. They never answered me and tablet burned. They are very irresponsible.

Reviews.Title: WARNING! COBY is out of business!
Reviews.Author: B. Williams
Reviews.Content: As of June 2013, Coby is DEFUNCT, There is no customer support or warranty service. For the cheap price it might be worth it to give it a try. Just be ready to throw it away of it breaks after the return period.

Reviews.Title: worked well until broke
Reviews.Author: clhtjh
Reviews.Content: it's a nice tablet especially for the price.the big downside is that my son accidentally broke the small flimsy pin inside the power port

Reviews.Title: Recommended
Reviews.Author: VE304245 Paúl Calderón
Reviews.Content: Very good machine for its price, arrived in good condition and fully operational, the only thing against it is that it has google play.

Reviews.Title: If You Love Buying Pieces Of Junk With No Support Then This Piece Of Crap Is Made Just For You !! Don't Wast Your Time Or Money!
Reviews.Author: Jim Yeager
Reviews.Content: "I Had This Item For Only 2 Days And It Completely Fell Apart USB Port Fell Out Of Item Locked Up And Would Not Let Me Factory Reset When Ever I Tried To Click On An App This Item Kept Makeing Double Icons Of the Same App When I Got This Item It Looked Like It Had Been Thrown Up Against A Wall Had Scratches and Gashes All Over Their Website For Customer Help Is Just A Page With Colby Written On It" Their Phone Numbers For Help Are Bogus Numbers, Website With Just Name Colby On It. Nothing Else.I Finally Sent This Back For A Full Refund And Now I Am Going To Buy A Kindle Fire 7 HD. I Own A 8.9. Never In My Life Of Dealing with Electronics Did I Ever See Such A Piece Of Junk. Do Your Selves A Favor A Buy A Kindle. You Will thank Yourself For That Decision Later. What A PIECE OF JUNK !! Can't Stress This Enough !!Actually This Item Doesn't Rate Even One Star, But I Put It There And Can't Remove It Now. So I Rate This Item With A ZERO STAR !!

Reviews.Title: Piece o' crap
Reviews.Author: Ambivalent Human
Reviews.Content: Yes, I said it! This tablet is a piece of crap. I bought two of these for two nephews as Christmas presents. The boys loved them while they lasted (except for GetJar, the app program that came loaded on the tablets). One of the tablets lasted until March, the other until June - so I guess they lasted longer than some of the reviewers' tablets on this site. But three months and six months is not much of an endorsement for this type of product. The problem in both cases was the charging port, which came loose inside, and now the tablets can't be charged. I returned the first one on June 3 along with a money order for $15, my receipt, peripherals and original packaging. I have yet to receive a replacement tablet or even acknowledgement of receipt, despite emails to the company. As one reviewer reported, it is impossible to speak to anyone from the company because the customer support line refers you to their website and doesn't give the option of talking to a representative or leaving a message. I just returned the other one and used certified mail in order to at least have someone's name as a reference when checking up on this. Given all the problems that so many people have had, I am contemplating filing a complaint with the Ohio attorney general. I'm also wondering if the company is getting ready to go out of business because of their crummy product and bad customer service. Maybe that is why you can't talk to an actual human being at the company customer service number. If I get any satisfaction, I will update this review.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service is Non-existent
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Tablet was ok - for its purpose and cost.  Customer ServiceI purchased 2 of these tablets for gifts for my two boys in December for Christmas gifts.  We do not let them use them often and control how they handle as they are 5 and 3.  After 4 months of having them, one would no longer charge. Upon calling Customer Service in June on how to repair, I was instructed to return to Coby Electronics in California via traceable mail along with a $15 Money Order for return postage.  After 8 weeks, the tablet was still at the warehouse for repair with no tracking number.  On August 1st, I called to check on the status again.  Now the Customer Service line has a recording that directs you to the website for assistance and then hangs up.  Emails, calls to the Headquarters all are a dead end as well.Now I am out the cost of the tablet, the shipping to, money order...and have to tell my 5 year old that he won't ever get "his" tablet back.

Reviews.Title: Very good product
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Perez
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this little tablet, and is of very good quality. It has fallen a few times and all ok ...All that remains to be "perfect" is Play Store.

Reviews.Title: mystery sale
Reviews.Author: robin j brunet
Reviews.Content: coby kyros co. doesn't respect their warranties for the public.i bought one for a 8yr old-having trouble getting it back/why.

Reviews.Title: BROKEN IN LESS THAN A YEAR
Reviews.Author: O. Sosa "Baseball"
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these tablets.  1 for each of my children.  In less than a year the power supply has broken on both.  I sent 1 in for repair and now I can't get a hold of any on the status of the repair.  Do NOT buy Coby products cause I've seen some articles about the layoffs off their personnel

Reviews.Title: Bought for grand daughter
Reviews.Author: Ray a Davidson
Reviews.Content: She loves the tablet and is now wanting the 1042 that I bought.  She does go on line with it but her primary use is for ebooks

Reviews.Title: cannot even turn it on
Reviews.Author: NoBama
Reviews.Content: never did work from the beginning. always had to have a needle or small paperclip on hand to reset unit. when it does come on, the only thing i was able to do was surf. the web. and if you walk away for a minute the unit locks and then comes the paperclip to reset. now the unit won't even turn on. barely used it for fear of not turning on and get my ire up.would not recommend this POS  unless you want to give it as a gift to your inlaws.

Reviews.Title: Coby Customer Service is horrible
Reviews.Author: CamperGirl
Reviews.Content: I purchased several of these tablets as Christmas gifts.  The charger port broke off inside the tablet on two of them.  One of them has been at Coby for more than six weeks.  I have little hope that I will  see either a repaired tablet or a replacement with in the next two weeks.

Reviews.Title: good table
Reviews.Author: Jose R. Tagle
Reviews.Content: Its was a gift to my wife and she loved it, i would by again, we use it to store music

Reviews.Title: Serves the purpose
Reviews.Author: R. Steed
Reviews.Content: This tablet does what the expensive tablets do for a fraction of the cost.  It performs as good as an ipad, just not as good as the picture.  I would reccomend this to anyone wanting to have a tablet around the house to use till able to afford a more advanced version.

Reviews.Title: Ok, but just ok.
Reviews.Author: Mister  Happy
Reviews.Content: Not a great tablet, but ok.  Cheap, both in price and construction.  You get what you pay for. Very okay.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Someone54
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet. It is hard to depict from other ones, but I really enjoyed using this Coby Kyros android. I guess I expected to connect the internet, but I was still surprised in how well it connects to various wi-fis. Plus, it touchscreen is phenomenal making all the feature easy to access. If you have the right memory card, say a New 32gb Micro Sd Card Sdhc Tf Flash Memory Card 32gb Class 10, New! Usa!, then there is a good chance you will be using this tablet for hours. I don't think you will be disappointed with this tablet. It really is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: 3 Stars.
Reviews.Author: Eugene373
Reviews.Content: My Device Turned on, but never booted. Design & looks I give it a 3 out of 5, but honestly I have no clue if this a good device.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: aja
Reviews.Content: I love the product. It is just like a computer but super portable and awesome.Anything a laptop can do so can this

Reviews.Title: Handy. Good for what I need it for.
Reviews.Author: waloper
Reviews.Content: It works well ,however there are times when it is slow. But, I think that has to more to do with the wifi modem than the tablet.Downloads easily and I find the publications I want to do download easily. I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Worst tablet ever!
Reviews.Author: AuntB
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? The battery life is terrible, it locks up constantly, and the touchscreen is not very sensitive at all. I would not recommend this tablet to anyone.

Reviews.Title: works, barely
Reviews.Author: Taylorlucy2
Reviews.Content: Bought this for Christmas for my daughter. I bought it on black friday and got a $10 discount. Knowing what I know now, I would have just went to Big Lots and bought one with a better screen for the same price (make sure to use a screen protecter or you will be screwed!). It works but barely in my opinion. If you are any distance away from the wifi, it won't download any apps or load web pages. Its does have the Amazon app store but not google play, which is fine for what we wanted it for. Also, as of this week, the battery adapter broke inside the tablet so now it is completely unuseable. Hopefully it is cover under the limited warranty but something tells me its not. Over all, it would be a good tablet for a very young child or and elderly person who doesnt know much about computers. Otherwise, save your money and buy a kindle.

Reviews.Title: 1st timer
Reviews.Author: Angeleyes
Reviews.Content: The charger / port does not connect smug or fit perfectly.  It seems that the charger is to large for the recipient port.

Reviews.Title: easy to get started on the internet
Reviews.Author: David Brettin
Reviews.Content: as far as i can tell it is easy to get started on the internet not like most  models that requiresome knowledge of computersto get onlinealso the ease of control of video's that don't stop and have to buffer in the middle of somethingsthe same for music player and internet radionon stop music!

Reviews.Title: Great overall
Reviews.Author: daniel
Reviews.Content: great little tablet does everything that i was it too do and alittle more but it does not have access to alot of drioid fetures unless you root it but we will see.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I got this for my daughter. I performs excellent. Coby has the best price. For the price and quality it performs great!

Reviews.Title: battery does not hold a charge
Reviews.Author: dahmoni
Reviews.Content: No matter how much I charge my tablet is, it is always dying. I love the  price. My kids enjoy it otherwise.

Reviews.Title: After 4 months of use the screen flipped backward so it's image is mirrored
Reviews.Author: Spotted Cow
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my Mom so she could play solitare on it. She loved it initially, but called me last night and said the screen looked wavey on one side and then the screen mirrored itself. I've tried turning it off completely and resetting it several times. I went into settings (which was not easy to navigate when everything is opposite) and did a factory data reset. Nothing has helped. I can't return it to Amazon.com for a refund so I contacted tech support at Coby to see what I have for options. I will be back to edit this after hearing from tech support.Edit 5/6/13: I called tech support today and will be shipping this tablet back to Coby to be repaired or replaced. I am disappointed that the instructions ask for a $15 money order for return shipping costs. I also have to pay for the shipping to the Coby repair center in Savannah, Georgia. The whole process takes 4-6 weeks after they receive my tablet.Edit 6/12/13: Coby received my tablet and $15 money order on May 9. After 4 weeks, I called the customer assistance number to get some information about the status of the tablet. I was told that the repair department is "behind because of a hurricane and the status of returns is usually updated on Mondays and Thursdays." I told the gentleman that I'd call back in a week. So I called today. It's now Week 5 and I was told that they didn't have a status update because "the woman that updates the computer with the repairs is precepting someone this week and the updates are behind." The return instructions stated "Please be advised; the process can be expected to take from 4-6 weeks total. Take note of the date that your package arrives in Savannah; 4 weeks from that date is the earliest date to start calling to get the return tracking number for the package coming back to you." So I guess I'll call next week....week 6. Not happy with the repair center of this company.Edit 6/24/13: called Coby today about update on my tablet. It's now week 7, still no information on their end about when the tablet will be shipped back. I was told the process takes "6-8 weeks" and I should call back next week. I will never purchase from Coby again!

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Vince
Reviews.Content: Got it used for 31 dollars! Such a steal! no google play though which is a bummer but who cares?

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet for kids...
Reviews.Author: R. M. GONZALEZ "msrockyg"
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these tablets for my kids' Christmas presents.  Well worth the money, no complaints!  Great for adults too.

Reviews.Title: Just okay
Reviews.Author: Melody Fisk
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this tablet, I just wish it had a few more bells and whistles. It's great for a beginner or anyone who just wants bare bones.

Reviews.Title: Slow
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: This product is very slow and very hard to download games or anything.  I am going to end up buy another one but it will not be a Coby

Reviews.Title: coby kyros 7 inch tablet
Reviews.Author: ashley
Reviews.Content: I do not like my tablet. As a family before Christmas 5 were bought and only 2 out of the 5 haven't been sent back. my husbands was sent back and his works perfect. mine on the other hand will only let me download and have a game or two on my tablet at one time. I don't think they were worth the money. I am very disappointed. the charger area is what broke on all the tablets and it happened to one of the replacements as well.

Reviews.Title: CAN NOT GET ANYTHING TO DOWNLOAD
Reviews.Author: geri
Reviews.Content: PLEASE EMAIL ME I CAN NOT GET ANY DOWNLOADS ALL IS BLANK. i HAVE TRIED TO BLANK A BLANK PAGE FOR WRITING NOTHING HAPPENS

Reviews.Title: FLIMSY charging port
Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: the charging port breaks very easily on this tablet. Do not buy! If the charging port was good this would be a good budget tablet.

Reviews.Title: under $100
Reviews.Author: ashy
Reviews.Content: It sucks.. the solder fir the headphone jack undid itself.. besides that the android isn't bad and it REAAALLLLLYYYYY sucks that it doesn't have Google play. But you can get #1mobile app. It just has all free games

Reviews.Title: Just Okay
Reviews.Author: Ms KWA
Reviews.Content: I brought this for my grandson, who is nine. It is just okay - I had to take another one back.  In fact i took two of them back to ToyRUs that did not work.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Marshia Cottrell
Reviews.Content: JUNK DID NOT LAST 2 WEEKS. . . .THE CHARGER PLUG ONLY GOES HALF WAY AND IF YOU TRY TO PUSH IN THE PLASTIC PIECE INSIDE BREAKS.

Reviews.Title: good enough
Reviews.Author: Cat Woman
Reviews.Content: I got this for Christmas for my son to try out.  I wanted something other than the expensive Ipad.  I was please with it until in one month the speaker started breaking up the sound.  In 2 months the speaker was no longer working, only the headphones worked.  At some point I will take it to see if it can be fixed (I think it will be a easy fix) but for now it is ok the way it is and my son doesn't mind.  I would be ok getting this for a child because it is not too expensive, compact and if they break it, it will not hurt too much.  Another thing, it tends to get kind of hot and may every now and then freeze up.  I would image that it is getting hot because of the internal CPU and may cause it to freeze.  This is not much of a problem to me and it has a reset button.  Would I get it again?  I would because it is inexpensive and the problems are very minor except for the speaker that part.  If you are a computer savy person than this is not for you.  Would I get this as a gift for someone? No because of the speaker issue.  I would get as a gift for a child as a test run for them.  The apps are good (lots of games) and software it uses I was please with.

Reviews.Title: Colby tablet
Reviews.Author: Vanessa
Reviews.Content: the items I bought don't want to charge worth nothing am sorry I spend my money because Colby is not a good brand next time I will do my research better before I buy any tablet, my lost no good can't exchange nomore.

Reviews.Title: work
Reviews.Author: old man 1959
Reviews.Content: it was what i paid for it was good no trouble so far all is working and if it dose i will be happy

Reviews.Title: C R A P ! !
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Opened the box and plugged it in to charge it, and the damn charge port broke. Cant even charge it via USB on the computer.

Reviews.Title: great!
Reviews.Author: Giorgi Baratashvili
Reviews.Content: it is a great tablet. the only shortfall that I notice is that it does not have a powerful wifi. in other words the wifi internet signal should be strong in order to connect it. but in general if you consider the price of the product this tablet is really great. thanks to COBY.

Reviews.Title: Good enough for the price
Reviews.Author: flexreel
Reviews.Content: Wanted something my younger children could use for homework and games so I couldhave my PC back. It works great, easy to use and they love it. I am intending to purchasean updated version if possible, this time with compatible Parental controls and Google play already in it.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Cperric
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my 7-year-old. She loved it. Although the touch screen is pretty shoddy and the device needed to be reset with a pin through the reset hole in the back every few weeks, it was cheap and could do a lot of different things. I even had an easy time rooting the device to allow for google play apps (the app service it tries to make you use had problems just letting you browse the apps).When I say the touch screen is shoddy, I mean that it is difficult interact with an interface that has buttons near the edge of the screen. The touch screen seems to have problems registering input near the edges.There is a reset hole in the back of the device. You must use a very narrow point (I use a safety pin) to press a button on board inside of the device through the hole. This will reset the device in case of system freeze. As I said, it happens every so often, but to be fair I did root the device although that is likely not the reason it locks up. I had a coby mp3 player that did the same thing.It worked for almost exactly 3 months before mysteriously going kaput. Considering the shipping costs and effort required to return this, I probably will just buy my daughter a higher quality device for her upcoming birthday.

Reviews.Title: tablet
Reviews.Author: kirstenjosiah
Reviews.Content: it broke again very easily my son is very upset it was the third tablet.my sons are 15 yr old twins who take good care of their things

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Donald O'Toole
Reviews.Content: The first on broke and had to be replaced. It is very limited in what it can do. Touch screen is poor half the time it brings you to the wrong place. Google play is blocked from the android device so you can't use many popular apps every time I try to go some where it says I can't because I haven't accessed google play when I try to access google play it says it is not available for this android device. I ended up buying a laptop instead this way I know I can access what I want. Too bad I didn't know about this later I could have applied the money I paid for this to the laptop.

Reviews.Title: Love It !
Reviews.Author: sandra
Reviews.Content: Like it says I love my Coby ,No problems with it . It's great. would recommend it to anyone looking for a tablet .

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't buy again
Reviews.Author: J. Mitchell "-James & Lynn Mitchell"
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Bought this for my 10yr old since he was the last in the family to have any kind of digital device. Didn't know that Google Play wasn't installed (nor can it be installed). This limits the Apps available. Wasn't such an issue until we've tried to put in some parental cntrls. The GetJar app that is installed is full of things that seem to be unworthy of Google, so it's kinda like shopping at the dollar store. You can install the Amazon App and the selection there isn't bad, but not having access into Google Play is a bummer.The device runs hot and battery life isn't all that great. It's a little slow when you flip it from portrait to landscape position, but not a real big issue unless you're playing a game that requires that sensor for control.The AC adapter plugs in at the bottom side when viewing like a book and can pop out easy if you're trying to use it while charging.Also found there to be few accessories available for this device that are sure to work, such as cases, screen protectors etc.All in all, it's okay as an intro, but not if you want to do much more than putz around with cheap/free apps and not really good for kids. Will look at a Samsung next time.

Reviews.Title: Power port is weak! Coby support STINKS!
